popt4jlib.DE

Class DblArray1VectorRndMaker

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.DE.DblArray1VectorRndMaker

  • public class DblArray1VectorRndMaker
extends java.lang.Object
    the class generates random vectors in R^n as VectorIntf objects that may obey certain bounding-box constraints.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      VectorIntf createNewRandomVector()
      returns a VectorIntf object whose dimensionality is equal to the parameter specified in the construction process by the key "dde.numdimensions".

    • Constructor Detail

      • DblArray1VectorRndMaker

        public DblArray1VectorRndMaker(java.util.Hashtable params)
        constructor. The parameters that must be passed in (the Hashtable arg) are as follows:
        • <"dde.numdimensions", Integer nd> mandatory, the number of dimensions
        • <"dde.minargval", Double v> optional, the min. value that any component of the returned vector may assume
        • <"dde.maxargval", Double v> optional, the max. value that any component of the returned vector may assume
        • <"dde.minargval"+$i$, Double v> optional, the min. value that the i-th component of the returned vector may assume (i={0,1,...nd.intValue()-1})
        • <"dde.maxargval"+$i$, Double v> optional, the max. value that the i-th component of the returned vector may assume (i={0,1,...nd.intValue()-1})

        The "local" constraints can only impose more strict constraints on the variables, but cannot be used to "over-ride" a global constraint to make the domain of the variable wider.
        Parameters:
        params - Hashtable

    • Method Detail

      • createNewRandomVector

        public VectorIntf createNewRandomVector()
                                 throws OptimizerException
        returns a VectorIntf object whose dimensionality is equal to the parameter specified in the construction process by the key "dde.numdimensions". The returned VectorIntf will obey the bounding-box constraints specified in the construction process.
        Returns:
        VectorIntf
        Throws:
        OptimizerException
